title: FailedToInsertDeposit
body:
## Description

I receive this error in my logs, over and over:
```
{
  "msg": "Failed to update eth1 cache",
  "level": "ERRO",
  "ts": "2020-05-27T09:02:20.147080658-05:00",
  "service": "eth1_rpc",
  "error": "Failed to update eth1 cache: FailedToInsertDeposit(NonConsecutive { log_index: 52, expected: 51 })",
  "retry_millis": "7000"
}

```
I run lighthouse with the following command:
`/home/lighthouse/.cargo/bin/lighthouse --logfile /data/lighthouse/logs/beacon.log beacon_node --eth1 --http --ws --datadir /data/lighthouse --http-address 0.0.0.0 --ws-address 0.0.0.0`

I run a Nethermind eth1 client, archive sync to Goerli, version `1.8.40`

I will say that this is as far as I got, I'm not running a validator yet. I wanted the beacon node to be up and running and in sync before I moved on to the next steps...

## Version

`Lighthouse 0.1.2`

## Present Behaviour

It's not clear to me what this log means, I searched for it but I couldn't find it.

## Expected Behaviour

Unknown

This is interesting.. it means that it's not getting the deposit logs in order. It's possible if the eth1 client undergoes a deep re-org, but that seems unlikely.

If you run `rm -r ~/.lighthouse/beacon` does the same error occur? It would be interesting to know if this is a one-off or a recurring issue.

I stopped the beacon node, deleted the beacon folder, restarted the service and yes, I get the same error.

It may have something to do with Nethermind?

> It may have something to do with Nethermind?

I do suspect this is the case. @pawanjay176, do I recall you having Lighthouse working on Nethermind. I know there's an issue about headers with Nethermind, but I don't think it looks like this.
Is there a JSON RPC command I can send directly to Nethermind to grab the output from? See how it's behaving?

@paulhauner nice to meet you, would you be able to hint at the problem with headers?
Also when you say the deposits are not coming in order, what do you mean there?

Hi @tkstanczak, nice to meet you too!

> would you be able to hint at the problem with headers?

I haven't been following these issues, so I'm a bit behind sorry. I thought there was an issue with Nevermind headers, but perhaps I'm mistaken. I know there's an issue here that we were dealing with: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/1958.

I might leave this up to @pawanjay176 since he has more knowledge here :)

> Also when you say the deposits are not coming in order, what do you mean there?

The [eth2 deposit contract](https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/dev/deposit_contract/contracts/validator_registration.vy) should be creating logs which have an always-increasing-by-one `deposit_count`. The error we're getting (`FailedToInsertDeposit(NonConsecutive { log_index: 52, expected: 51 })`) is indicating that is not the case. I've never seen this on Geth/OpenEthereum before, perhaps it's some sort of subtle difference between the implementations? Ofc, it could be a problem on our end too. Is there anything that jumps to mind @tkstanczak? :)

Hey @MysticRyuujin, wasn't able to reproduces the issue.
I am running a archive synced Nethermind 1.8.40-1-8fdc72ff0-20200528/X64-Linux and don't get the error. As Paul mentioned, the logs indicate that the deposit logs received from the eth1 node are not in order. 
Can you send me the output of this JSON rpc command so I can compare with my output? I'm @pawan on the lighthouse discord channel. 
```sh
curl --location --request POST 'localhost:8545/' \
                               --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
                               --data-raw '{
                               "jsonrpc":"2.0",
                               "method":"eth_getLogs",
                               "params":[{"address":"0x42cc0fceb02015f145105cf6f19f90e9bea76558","fromBlock":2760066,"toBlock":2772924,"topics":["0x649bbc62d0e31342afea4e5cd82d4049e7e1ee912fc0889aa790803be39038c5"]}],
                               "id":1
                               }'
```
Also, are you running latest Lighthouse master branch?

Here is the output of that curl command:
[output.txt](https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/files/4696048/output.txt)

As for version, yesterday I installed it using the instructions here:
https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/installation.html

```
git clone https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse.git
cd lighthouse
make
```

```
lighthouse@eth2test:~/lighthouse$ git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean
```

FYI, I have 3 validators and they're all working...idk what the significance of this log is in relation to that.

https://witti.beaconcha.in/dashboard?validators=448,451,464
This may help, a debug log of all Witti deposit logs, datas, validators, etc.: https://gist.github.com/protolambda/34a44e23720ee6666e551d64e6a1dddc

So it looks like the nethermind node for some reason didn't process a deposit log. 

[This](https://gist.github.com/pawanjay176/780fd3d801c5df1d27def6cdc4aa2038) is a comparison of the deposits on the witti deposit contract fetched from an infura geth node vs the potentially buggy nethermind node generated using proto's [tool](https://github.com/protolambda/eth2-deposit-watch) . 

The nethermind node did not return valid deposit log `#51` on the witti deposit contract which caused the error.

To be clear, I synced a nethermind node locally (both fast mode and archive mode) and got the correct logs. I was only able to reproduce this by querying @MysticRyuujin 's nethermind node.
I did a fresh fast sync and the error went away. This could be another case of data corruption on my end. :-1: sorry everyone.
This is a bug in Nethermind and is being fixed in https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/1980
This has been fixed in Nethermind and will be in their next release :tada:

Hi, I'm having this same problem. Fresh installation of `lighthouse v1.0.5 Baby Legs`. My `geth v1.9.25-stable-e7872729` is fully synced, and turning on the beacon node with this command: `lighthouse bn --staking --eth1-endpoints "http://127.0.0.1:8545,http://127.0.0.1:8546" --graffiti "⌨⌨" --freezer-dir "/ext-hdd/freezer" --port "9001" --target-peers "75"` ``` ERRO Failed to update eth1 cache error: Failed to update eth1 cache: "FailedToInsertDeposit(NonConsecutive { log_index: 5821, expected: 5016 })", retry_millis: 7000, service: eth1_rpc ERRO Failed to update eth1 cache error: Failed to update eth1 cache: "FailedToInsertDeposit(NonConsecutive { log_index: 5821, expected: 5016 })", retry_millis: 7000, service: eth1_rpc INFO Syncing est_time: 4 hrs 53 mins, speed: 8.00 slots/sec, distance: 141119 slots (2 weeks 5 days), peers: 78, service: slot_notifier WARN Syncing eth1 block cache est_blocks_remaining: initializing deposits, msg: sync can take longer when using remote eth1 nodes, service: slot_notifier ``` It seems like the beacon node is working fine, but the error will continually log out.

@NessDan your geth node could be corrupted. Can you run the script here
https://github.com/pawanjay176/deposits-checker/blob/master/main.py

```
python3 main.py http://localhost:8545 <TRUSTED-INFURA-ENDPOINT>
```

If your geth node is fine, it should print out `All calls match` in the end.

**EDIT:** I think I was being rate-limited by infura, trying another node.
**EDIT 2:** Re-ran with alchemy as my node and it didn't work (same issue.) I've tried removing all of `~/.lighthouse` and my freezer directory seeing if that works.

@pawanjay176 thanks for the script, it was making progress but suddenly:

```
Checking in range 11313524 11314524
Checking in range 11314524 11315524
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 665, in urlopen
    httplib_response = self._make_request(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 421, in _make_request
    six.raise_from(e, None)
  File "<string>", line 3, in raise_from
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 416, in _make_request
    httplib_response = conn.getresponse()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 1347, in getresponse
    response.begin()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 307, in begin
    version, status, reason = self._read_status()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 276, in _read_status

http.client.RemoteDisconnected: Remote end closed connection without response

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 439, in send
    resp = conn.urlopen(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 719, in urlopen
    retries = retries.increment(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/util/retry.py", line 400, in increment
    raise six.reraise(type(error), error, _stacktrace)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/six.py", line 702, in reraise
    raise value.with_traceback(tb)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 665, in urlopen
    httplib_response = self._make_request(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 421, in _make_request
    six.raise_from(e, None)
  File "<string>", line 3, in raise_from
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 416, in _make_request

  File "/usr/lib/python3.8/http/client.py", line 1347, in getresponse
    response.begin()

```
@NessDan looks like there's some issue with your local node as it suddenly closed connection. You can ping me on the sigp discord (pawan) and I can try to help you out.

Update for anyone who finds this thread: Since this was a fresh installation of lighthouse (no validators imported or anything important) I was able to delete the `~/.lighthouse` directory along with my freezer folder and it synced up perfectly.

Seems like the issue was me launching Lighthouse before my eth 1 node had synced.
